description:
The Branch Manager is responsible for the overall administration and efficient daily operation of a full service branch office, including operations, team development, opening accounts, lending, customer service, and security and safety in accordance with the Bank's objectives.
  

  
Qualifications:
  
•Demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service.
  
•Proficient computer skills, math aptitude and attention to detail is a must.
  
•Demonstrated strong leadership skills and dependability.
  
•Effectively communicate and demonstrate strong time management skills as required.
  
•Able to work well under pressure and be able to meet deadlines
  
•Minimum three years solid management experience in a retail environment is required, including managing a staff, coaching, and meeting goals. Banking environment desirable.
  
•Excellent demonstrable time management, communication and motivational skills are necessary.
  
•Bachelor’s degree required or commensurate experience.
  
•Must be willing to work a flexible schedule, including some evenings and Saturdays.
  
•A valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle is required.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  
•Consistently provide quality service as outlined in the Bank’s Quality Service Statement.
  
•Directly impact the growth and retention of customers through proactive efforts.  This can be accomplished by managing Online RB, ensuring their team is offering customers additional products and services, and holding regular monthly call nights to follow-up on any lists created by the Marketing Department, as well as, other sources of referrals from inside the branch.
  
•Focus on building a customer service driven team where everyone contributes to the success of the Relationship Building and Operational efforts.
  
•Develop and motivate the team members of their Office by offering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement. This can be accomplished at regular team meetings and through individual documented coaching sessions. Continue the development of the Operation and Relationship Manager’s leadership skills by offering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement through individual documented coaching sessions.
  
•Represent Dollar Bank in the community in a professional and competent manner at all times. Is expected to source business deposit and loan relationships within the surrounding communities through active participation in various organizations and charitable functions.
  
•Meet the established Group Banking Onsite Visit and Checking Accounts Opened goals each month. This will be accomplished by being proactive in outside calling efforts and by taking advantage all Group Banking opportunities within his market.
  
•Exhibit operational knowledge while upholding the operational integrity of the office by assisting the team in all areas of branch operations including Compliance.
  
•Achieve all Relationship Building, Operational Integrity, and Customer Service goals.
  
•Exercise sound decision-making skills as it relates to balancing risk, profitability, and customer service with every decision.
  
•Consistently lead by example, maintain professionalism and a positive attitude at all times and exercise superior leadership skills.

title: Branch Manager

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
Digital is a rapidly growing and critical area at Dollar Bank.  The VP of Digital Product Management will be responsible for helping to plan, create, and execute the digital strategy across the bank’s lines of business.  This person will create and manage the roadmaps for all digital platforms (mobile & online) and lead all components of the product life cycle for digital platforms, services, and features.  Responsibilities also include working with the marketing, technology, customer service, legal, accounting, risk, and other areas of the bank to ensure clear communications and timely issue resolution to deliver continual improvement for our digital efforts.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, Management, Technology, or a related discipline required;
  
• 8-10+ years of product management experience in the digital/mobile space including developing and delivering on digital/mobile strategy initiatives.
  
• Demonstrated experience in an online product management role driving the development and implementation of online strategies.
  
• Proven ability to develop product roadmaps, define requirements and lead implementation efforts successfully.
  
• Demonstrated experience guiding online/mobile user design experiences.
  
• Demonstrated experience managing complex projects.
  
• Superior quantitative and analytical skills, critical thinking, and ability to synthesize data and draw conclusions.
  
• Demonstrated communications, interpersonal, and relationship management skills; ability to work well as part of a cross-functional team and lead across the organization at multiple levels.
  
• Ability to influence diverse, cross functional team to success without direct authority over the team.
  
• Excellent verbal, writing and presentation skills.
  
• Passion for customers and a demonstrated focus on customer experience.
  
• Personal computer skills – particularly Microsoft Office programs – and the demonstrated ability to quickly learn new software/systems.
  
• Strong thought leadership required to manage the development and growth of products.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
• Manage overall customer experience for the digital products and services assigned and provide strategic direction and drive enhancements via 1-3 yr roadmaps.
  
• Develop strategic roadmap based on in-depth understanding of (1) voice of the customer; (2) competitive analysis; (3) profitability; (4) product life cycle; and (5) vendor/platform capabilities.
  
• Partner with retail and business banking teams to create and use digital assets to help the businesses achieve their objectives.
  
• Work with project managers to oversee a portfolio of projects to provide for the digital needs of customers and prospective customers.
  
• Develop and manage annual Key Performance Indicators for assigned digital products and provide monthly digital scorecard and analysis that tracks results monthly for adoption and growth.
  
• Partner with Marketing for adoption & acquisition support, product positioning, promotion of digital products and services and onboarding activities.
  
• Act as the SME to understand all aspects of the internal and external environment including customer met/unmet digital needs through research efforts, in-depth understanding of voice of the customer, industry trends, vendor/platform capabilities and best practices for servicing the digital needs of our customers.
  
• Continuously assess & report on competitive moves and monitor digital platform performance against objectives.
  
• Develop business cases and perform cost/benefit analysis as needed to secure funding for enhancements and initiatives.
  
• Present data, strategies and recommendations to senior management to build buy-in to strategic recommendations including new services, updates to existing services, and retiring existing services.
  
• Prioritize product requirements and coordinate release plans with IT and key constituents.
  
• Act as the Chair person for the cross functional Internet Committee.
  
• Serve as primary business point of contact & decision maker for implementation activities and work closely across key constituents to meet scheduled milestones.
  
• Document high level descriptions and detailed business requirements to enable resource estimates from technology and QA teams.

description:
Dollar Bank, a solid and progressive financial institution since 1855 continues to expand our business and is currently seeking a Customer Service Specialist for its Westgate branch.
  

  
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
As a Customer Service Specialist, you will be responsible for identifying our customers’ financial needs by providing a thorough analysis and recommending the most appropriate Dollar Bank products and services to fulfill those needs. You will use your customer service experience, product knowledge and positive demeanor to initiate, expand and retain customer relationships through customer conversations and outbound calling. We are looking for flexible, enthusiastic, hardworking individuals with a sincere appreciation for people and an empathetic communication style to proactively contribute to the branch sales and service goals.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
In a typical banking day you will enjoy a high level of customer contact. The primary focus of this role includes:
  
•Providing quality customer service in a positive, courteous and enthusiastic manner to all internal and external customers
  
•Contributing to the growth and retention of deposit and loan customers. Demonstrating a proactive sales approach to building customer relationships, effectively utilizing the customer conversations to promote Dollar Bank products and services and meeting the established Relationship Building goals set by your management team.
  
•Performing teller functions based upon the needs of the branch. Maintaining an acceptable balancing record while processing transactions in an accurate and efficient manner.
  
•Adhering to all established branch operational processes and procedures.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
  

  
•High school diploma/GED required.
  
•College degree required, or a minimum of 1 year demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service in financial services or retail industry.
  
•Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to include professional grammar and demeanor.
  
•Ability to work a flexible schedule including evenings and Saturdays.
  
•Ability to travel as needed to training.
  
•Successful candidate must meet and comply with all requirements set forth in the SAFE Act, including, but not limited to successful completion of the required background checks, and obtaining a unique identifier by the NMLS.

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
Responsible for implementing Configuration and Test Data Processes and Tools while maintaining Compliance with Internal and External Regulators.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Minimum 10 years I/T related Management Experience required.
  
• Bachelor’s Degree in an I/T related field.  Master’s Degree a plus. Will consider commensurate experience.
  
• Prior experience managing multiple simultaneous projects as well as resources with diverse I/T backgrounds such as Quality Analysts, DBA’s, Developers, Configuration Managers and Infrastructure Support Analysts.
  
• Prior Leadership or Management role in at least 1 Merger and Acquisition Project.
  
• Information Technology Information Library (ITIL) v3 certification with a strong focus on the following ITIL frameworks:  Configuration Management System, Service Testing & Validation, Release & Deployment Management.
  
• SCRUM Master Certification
  
• Must be able to negotiate deliverables, staffing, and deadlines to meet or exceed expectations with quality product while keeping individuals abreast of current developments
  
• Demonstrated ability to communicate and influence effectively with all levels of the organization including C Level
  
• Strong Test Environment Management and Enterprise Monitoring Skills as well as Test Data Automation
  
• Thorough understanding of Regulatory Requirements such as SOX compliance and Experience working with Internal and External Auditors
  
• Prior experience Managing projects involving multiple teams as well as 3rd party vendors.
  
• Analytical and intuitive thinker with an exceptional attitude
  
• Ability to work both independently and within a team environment with tight deadlines and changing priorities
  
• Strong experience in formal Root Cause Analysis for Production Incidents and issues related to Configuration and Data Management
  
• Excellent communicator with proactive approach
  
• Flexibility and ability to adapt to change and cultural realities
  
• Advanced understanding of workflow management / configuration management processes and tools and able to develop and implement workflows related to Quality Management.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Have Cross Functional Matrixed Management responsibilities for resources with varying disciplines including Distributed and Mainframe Developers, Quality Analyst, DBA’s and Consultants.
  
• Maintain ongoing Compliance including the discovery and elimination of PII in lower environments
  
• Ensure all Test Environment data is De-Identified and implement manual and automated data refresh processes that allows for adequate defect discovery with on-demand synthetic data generation for data specific test scenarios.
  
• Develop TDM processes specifically to address Bank Conversions including compensating controls related to situations in which PII is required for Testing
  
• Implement Integration Service Virtualization eliminating the need and expense for 3rd party test environment integration
  
• Identify environment deficiencies and align technical infrastructure with production - Identify and address “We can’t test that” situations
  
• Manage lower environment release and deployment activities with PMO, QM, DD&I, SD&I, Infrastructure, and Telecom to align with production releases - Ensure adequate test environments to support simultaneous development of maintenance, production emergency fixes and major releases for critical client facing applications
  
• Coordinate activities to automate the setup and configuration of test environments
  
• Track releases, upgrades and changes to the test environments and perform periodic audits
  
• Develop KPIs to track efficiency of test environment services as well as change / configuration audits
  
• Implement Environment Monitoring / Logging and coordinate and resolve all environment related defects
  
• Provide ongoing support for all test environments
  
• Creates and Implements DevOps Strategies to unify software development, software operations and testing.  Implements the automation and monitoring at all steps of software construction, from integration, testing, releasing to deployment and infrastructure management
  
• Maintain Code and Configuration Management Compliance with FFIEC guidelines and best practices
  
• Responsible for software build and release strategy and the development of Configuration Management Plans
  
• Creates branching, merging, versioning and release strategies
  
• Define and implement automated build / deployment standards and maintain schedules
  
• Reduce costs associated with current source code management tools by implementing alternative industry standard tool sets
  
• Implement configuration management strategies which include Today’s practice of DevOps allowing for continuous design, development, testing and deployment as well as aligning with Agile development
  
• Performs periodic Configuration Management Audits and ensures compliance
  
• Implements a formal Root Cause Analysis process for Production Incidents as well as issues related to Configuration and Data Management

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
The Staff auditor performs assigned tasks and prepares supporting schedules and work papers as part of an audit team when examining and evaluating the adequacy and effectiveness of the system of controls.  The information gathered by the auditors and their findings are communicated to management in a timely and reliable manner to assist management in evaluating and furthering the quality and efficiency of its operations.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
•Assists and/or conducts audits of assigned departments and/or branch offices to evaluate the adequacy, effectiveness and efficiency of the internal control system, and to determine compliance with established bank policies, procedures, government regulations and industry best practices.
  
•Performs audit program steps for assigned audits under the direction of an in-charge auditor.
  
•Determines compliance with policies and procedures.
  
•Documents an understanding of policies, procedures and the internal control system.
  
•Documents audit testing in a concise manner through preparation of detailed audit work papers prepared in accordance with departmental standards.
  
•Provides clear explanations of audit procedures performed in audit work papers.
  
•Prepares conclusions on the system on internal control based upon the results of the work performed.
  
•Presents any irregularities to in-charge auditor along with the proposed disposition.
  
•Documents exceptions to bank policies and procedures and internal control weaknesses.
  
•Assists external auditors with their annual review.
  
•Performs special projects and assignments under direction of department management.
  
•Evaluates procedures while completing the audit to determine the existence of any possible recommendations for improved efficiency.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
•B.A. or B.S. in Accounting or business related degree required.  Audit experience strongly preferred.
  
•Proficiency in applying internal auditing standards, procedures and techniques while performing internal audits.
  
•Proficiency in accounting principals and techniques is required of auditors who work with the bank’s financial records and reports.
  
•An understanding of internal control principles is required to be able to recognize and evaluate deviations during the course of an audit.
  
•An understanding of computer concepts and controls is required.
  
•Proficiency in the use of a computer (MS Word, Excel).
  
•Good writing skills in order to prepare well-documented work papers and draft audit exception items as a basis for the formal audit report to management.
  
•Ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing with customers and bank employees.

title: Staff Auditor

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
This position would be primarily responsible for Noninterest Income management reporting and analysis for Dollar Bank and your job duties.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Prepare a comprehensive monthly Noninterest Income reporting package for senior management.  Report includes financial schedules and commentary as well as key drivers and volume analysis detail.
  
• Track drivers and trends of Noninterest income products including Overdraft, ATM, Debit Card, Credit Card, Deposits, and Treasury Management.
  
• Participate in month-end close process.  Ensure financial results are accurate and prepare accruals as necessary.
  
• Review and document monthly variances to forecast and budget.  Interact with various areas of Dollar Bank, including Accounting, Product management, and business units to research material variances as needed.
  
• Create and enhance existing forecast modeling for Fee products using a driver based approach.
  
• Develop annual fee budgets and monthly forecasts.  Proactively identify opportunities and risks while ensuring that they are reflected in forecast or budget.  Work with business partners to identify and develop solutions that help mitigate risk items.
  
• Opportunity to work on assignments outside of fee reporting duties, gaining exposure to different areas of Dollar Bank.
  
• Assist with reporting and budget/forecast development for Branch Banking and Residential Lending Divisions of Dollar Bank.  Prepare and distribute monthly budget variance reports to business units within these divisions.
  
• Respond to other ad hoc inquiries and/or reporting needs.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Bachelor’s Degree in Finance / Accounting or related area required.
  
• Minimum of 3 years’ of financial analysis experience (preferably at a financial institution) required.
  
• Working knowledge of Hyperion Essbase and Oracle required.
  
• Strong PC skills including Microsoft Excel, Word, Access, and PowerPoint.  Proficiency with intermediate/advanced excel skills for data analysis is essential.
  
• Knowledge of banking fee items such as Overdraft, ATM, Debit Card, Credit Card, Deposits, and Treasury Management a plus.
  
• Ability to demonstrate an understanding of the big picture, while working through the details required to constructing a budget / forecast.
  
• Detailed oriented, diligent with strong organizational and analytical skills.
  
• Strong interpersonal skills for effective interaction with business partners.
  
• A demonstrated ability to work independently.
  
• Exceptional organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple competing priorities while consistently meeting deadlines.
  
• Effective written and verbal communication skills.
  
• A proactive, action-oriented approach to problem solving.

description:
Hours of this position are Monday through Friday 1:00 PM to 9:15 PM
  

  
As a ACH Processor you will be a member of Dollar Bank’s Automated Clearing House Operations team. The purpose of this position is to facilitate the receipt and origination of ACH transactions for Dollar Bank retail and corporate customers. Candidates will perform multiple job functions related to the processing of ACH transactions. You will use your research skills and risk avoidance skills to accurately and efficiently insure that files are processed within established guidelines and meet critical deadlines.
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES / OBJECTIVES:
  

  
•Process incoming and outgoing ACH files.
  
•Monitor established ACH risk controls.
  
•Provide statistical reporting to management.
  
•Possess a thorough knowledge and understanding of the ACHplus software package.
  
•Process new client set-up in ACHplus.
  
•Balance with Federal Reserve, Accounting, and internal General Ledger system on a daily basis.
  
•Research and answer customer inquiries.
  
•Process non-complex reclamations from Federal Government Agencies and other originators within appropriate time frames.
  
•Insure daily functions are completed accurately and within the deadlines of the department.
  
•Complete additional duties as assigned.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  
•High School Diploma/GED required.
  
•Working knowledge of ACH is required, including good balancing skills and an understanding of debit and credit transactions; banking experience is preferred.
  
•Ability to demonstrate good problem solving and technical skills, as well as an attention to detail and a good math aptitude.
  
•Must be a highly motivated self-starter, a team player, flexible, and lead by example.
  
•Proficient computer skills including Microsoft with the ability to learn multiple applications and maneuver between multiple applications.
  
•Proficient Excel skills are preferred.
  
•Must possess good written and verbal communication skills, as well as strong customer service skills.
  
•Ability to move large sums of money within established policies and operating procedures.
  
•Must be willing to learn State and Federal Regulations, including but not limited to Regulation J, Regulation E, UCC Law, OFAC and NACHA.
  
•Must be willing to learn NACHA (National Automated Clearing House Association) rules regarding credit and debit processing requirements.
  
•Must be willing to begin studying and passing the National Automated Clearing House Association Accredited ACH Professional Certification test.

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
Develop relationships with current and prospective customers with the goal of generating opportunities to promote the Bank’s products and services in the workplace and obtain new customer relationships. Loan Center Representative will be responsible for generating new consumer loans and its associated products and services through various proactive efforts.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• A minimum of 1 year of related sales experience required with a proven track record of achieving desired results required.
  
• High School Diploma/GED required. Bachelor’s degree strongly preferred.
  
• Demonstrated ability and desire to consistently deliver quality service and build customer relationships.
  
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills and ability to conduct formal presentations.
  
• Demonstrated proactive techniques, creativity, resourcefulness, and self-motivation in producing results.
  
• Working knowledge of Microsoft Word and Excel.
  
• Demonstrated ability to manage and perform multiple tasks while delivering professional results.
  
• Access to reliable transportation required.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Personally provide quality customer service to all internal and external customers.

description:
JOB FUNCTION / PURPOSE:
  

  
The Treasury Management Sales Support Admin. is responsible for assisting Treasury Management (TM) sales representatives with development of TM business. Primary responsibilities include coordination and support of client product implementations, daily customer service needs, complex service issues, and continuous support.  This position services as the liaison between TM and the customer for all phone calls, issues, concerns, operational needs and general “online systems support”.   This role also provides training to customers on features and functions of services and products coupled with general administrative assistance to TM Sales Officers with the coordination of sales of TM products.
  

  
The TM Sales Support Admin. is also responsible for development of automated and manual risk reporting routines for specified products.  This role will be required to advise TM representatives and management of potential risks based upon technical knowledge and best practices.
  

  
PRINCIPLE DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
  
•Provide general customer support for TM Sales Officers; process customer requests for assistance with treasury management products and services; research inquiries regarding overdrafts, transfers, service charges, and account performance.
  
•Analyze risk review process as assigned for ACH, Wire Transfer, Remote Deposit or Funds Availability as required.
  
•Analyze and monitor specific assigned risk functions for ACH, Wire Transfer, Remote Deposit or Funds Availability as required for any designated customer.
  
•Implement sold TM services:
  
o Opening new accounts, order checks, endorsement stamps as needed.
  
o Preparing and mail welcome packets.
  
o Completing documentation (regulatory and internal) to successfully implement all sold products and services (service agreements/riders).
  
•Implement new business set-up of TM products and services including pre/post sale customer documentation.
  
•Sustain an ongoing understanding of TM products and services; keep abreast of regulatory and policy changes affecting TM to ensure compliance.
  
•Consistently address and manage escalated client issues.
  
•Initiate updates to procedure manual as needed.
  
•Maintain ongoing communication with internal and external customers for the successful implementation of TM services and account maintenance.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  
•College degree or banking/admin. experience required.
  
•Knowledge of banking depository, cash management products, banking systems and branch operations recommended.
  
•Strong analytical skills; ability to navigate systems, access data, reconcile numbers, identify discrepancies and understand drivers of change within data.
  
•Effective oral and written communications.
  
•Ability to resolve escalated client issues and proactively diffuse conflict.
  
•Proficient in MS Office, specifically Word (Candidate will be tested).

description:
The Desktop Support Technician II is responsible for the mid-level support and maintenance of all computer equipment and end user technical support at Dollar Bank Servicing Center.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Bachelor’s Degree preferred in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field. Will accept minimum of four years of professional work experience in lieu of education.
  
• Must have at least two years of extensive personal computer experience and at least two years of network experience.
  
• This network experience should include but not be limited to installing and trouble-shooting network hardware/software, as well as training and supporting users in a Windows/Ethernet environment.
  
• Must have a fundamental knowledge of computers and operating systems.
  
• Fundamental experience with desktop troubleshooting and resolving printer and multifunction device issues.
  
• A strong knowledge of networking protocols, especially TCP/IP is also required.
  
• Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  
• Willingness to learn and keep abreast of new skills and techniques.
  
• Good organizational skills and the ability to multi-task.
  
• Must possess excellent communication skills, both written and oral.
  
• Ability to analyze and anticipate situations.
  
• Must have the ability to lift 25 pounds.
  
• Must have a valid driver’s license.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• End User Support – Provide mid-level troubleshooting of software, hardware, peripherals and printers. Escalate to Level 3 after 1 day of troubleshooting.
  
• Desktop Lifecycle Management – Design and create master operating system images. Coordinate with end-users and the Level 1 team to provide a timely workstation installation and/or replacement.
  
• Laptop Management – Manage the laptop lifecycle process. Assist the Inventory Management Team with the documentation process and end-user signoff. Secure laptops with the installation and configuration of encryption software. Coordinate with internal teams to install and configure the bank’s VPN software.
  
• User Education – Provide end-users with intermediate computer training, to ensure projects are delivered on time, within budget, adhere to high quality standards and meet customer expectations.
  
• Responsible for assembling project plans and teamwork assignments, directing and monitoring work efforts on a daily basis, identifying resource needs, performing quality review; and escalating functional, quality, timeline issues appropriately. Responsible for tracking key project milestones and adjusting project plans and/or resources to meet the needs of customers.
  
• Assist Level 3 with Image design and development
  

  
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
  
Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). See, hear, talk and perform tasks requiring manual dexterity and visual acuity; sit, stand, walk, crouch, reach, pull, push and other similar, repetitive tasks requiring physical activity. Able to operate standard office/computer equipment such as photocopiers, fax machines, computers, iPads, scanners, calculators, etc.

Qualifications:
  

  
•Demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service.

•Demonstrated strong leadership skills and dependability.
  
•Effectively communicate and demonstrate strong time management skills as required.
  
•Able to work well under pressure and be able to meet deadlines

•Exhibit operational knowledge while upholding the operational integrity of the office by assisting the team in all areas of branch operations including Compliance.
  
•Achieve all Relationship Building, Operational Integrity, and Customer Service goals.

Job Overview:
  

  
The Tax Accountant is responsible for supporting the Tax Department in the timely and accurate preparation of all applicable tax filings in accordance with local, state, and federal guidelines.  In addition, the Tax Accountant is responsible for maintaining the Fixed Asset System, used to calculate book and tax depreciation for the Bank and its subsidiaries.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Minimum Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or related field required. Will consider commensurate experience.
  
• Internship or accounting related work experience preferred.
  
• Working knowledge in Microsoft Excel preferred; Oracle a plus.
  
• Ability to manage time and workload efficiently.
  
• Ability to effectively communicate.
  
• Ability to pay close attention to detail with accuracy.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Assist in preparation and filing of federal corporate income tax returns.
  
• Assist in preparation and filing of state and local income tax returns.
  
• Assist in preparation and filing of estimated income tax payments.
  
• Assist in preparation and filing of payroll tax reports.
  
• Assist in preparation of state sales and use tax reports.
  
• Prepare and file personal property tax returns.
  
• Provide support to the annual filing of information returns.
  
• Prepare monthly income tax provision and effective tax rate.
  
• Prepare analysis and entries for current and deferred income tax accounts.
  
• Prepare tax footnote for the annual audited financial statements.
  
• Maintain and balance the fixed asset system and related accounts.
  
• Reconcile assigned ledger accounts monthly.
  
• Process remittances of taxes withheld.

title: Part-time Teller Trainee Fox Chapel

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
The Mortgage Underwriting Officer will guarantee that all loan application packages, through thorough analysis, contain the appropriate information and documentation that is necessary to satisfy the requirements of the bank, Freddie Mac, Fannie Mae, FHA, VA, Bond Programs, URA, and various other underwriting agency guidelines. This employee will provide an approval or rejection of the loan application based on an informed underwriting decision using the above guidelines.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Minimum of three years of underwriting experience of Conforming and Jumbo Loans, including FHA, Conventional and VA is required for this position; Reverse Mortgage and Consumer Underwriting experience is preferred.
  
• FHA Certification is required.
  
• High School Diploma/GED required. College Degree preferred,
  
• Thorough knowledge of loan processing and closing procedures.
  
• Demonstrated ability and desire to provide high quality customer service.
  
• Demonstrated ability to communicate effectively both orally and in writing.
  
• Proven analytical skills.
  
• Candidate will have proficient computer skills and the ability to learn Dollar Bank’s software packages.
  
• Candidate must be well versed in AUS and manual underwriting methods.  Collateral Underwriter system with Fannie Mae is preferred.
  
• Demonstrated ability to handle a high volume of productivity.
  
• Must be detail oriented, organized and work efficiently under pressure.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Complete a detailed analysis of the appraisal report and loan file to insure the standard necessary to conform to the underwriting guidelines listed above.
  
• Accurately determine the borrower’s ability and willingness to repay the debt.
  
• Document the system for approval or rejection outside of the standard underwriting procedures.
  
• Maintain knowledge of underwriting guidelines and stay current with department requirements.
  
• Respond accurately to underwriting questions from the loan originators and correspondents to insure that consistent policy and procedures are followed as prescribed by the Bank.
  
• Assist in the development or changes in application, processing, underwriting and underwriting procedures affected by changes in the underwriting guidelines listed above or by changes in the system.
  
• Instruct loan processors in new procedures or the review of existing procedures.
  
• Review loan package(s) after initial processing step is completed to identify critical areas that could adversely affect the probability of loan approval.  Provide the appropriate follow up in these areas.
  
• Maintain complete awareness of quality customer service through effective communication and by presenting the Bank in a positive, professional and courteous manner.

**FLSA:**  Exempt

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
This position is responsible for providing advanced Health Monitoring, Troubleshooting, and System Maintenance for the Distributed Services servers and systems. The Distributed Services department is responsible for over 600 servers, both physical and virtual, over 100 Microsoft SQL Database, over 150 business applications and over 70 branches throughout the Eastern United States.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
•Provide Level 2 technical support and assist with Level 1.
  
•Escalation of  issues to Level 3 after appropriate SLA.
  
•Monitor the operating system environment, troubleshoot and maintain system integrity.
  
•Provide advanced troubleshooting of server, operating system and application related issues.
  
•Assists Level 3, and guides Level 1 to perform detailed system design, configuration, implementation, documentation and support.
  
•Prioritize IT request and issues from conception through implementation.
  
•Participate in the server build, maintenance, and turndown process.
  
•Assist with the implementation of emerging technologies and systems.
  
•High interactions with other team members and business unit personnel.
  
•Participate in disaster recovery testing.
  
Familiarize, gain experience, and comply with change control procedures.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
•Associate’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or other related field is required.  Will accept professional experience in lieu of education.
  
•Minimum of four years’ experience with Microsoft Windows Operating Systems Installation and Configuration is required.
  
•Minimum of four years’ experience VMWare/Virtualized Server maintenance is required.
  
•Minimum of two years’ experience of Remote Software Deployment and IT automation including scripting is required.
  
•Fundamental understanding of Active Directory is required.
  
•Fundamental knowledge of current Linux Operating Systems is preferred.
  
•Fundamental knowledge of networking protocols, especially TCP/IP is preferred.
  
•Fundamental knowledge of Terminal Server, File\\Print Server, VPN Software, DNS, and DHCP is preferred.
  
•Fundamental understanding of infrastructure: including firewalls (local), databases, malware protection software and other processes is preferred.
  
•Fundamental understanding of security concepts preferred, in particular PII, PCI, SOX, and GLBA.
  
•Must have the ability to lift 25 pounds.
  
•Must have the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
  
•Must be able to work in a team.
  
•Must possess a valid driver’s license.
  
**Address:**  Liberty Commons Building
  
**Employment Status:**  Full-time

Dollar Bank is currently seeking a Branch Manager for its Richmond branch. The Branch Manager is responsible for the overall production of the branch, team development, and efficient daily operation of a full service office.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service.
  
• Proficient computer skills, math aptitude and attention to detail is a must.
  
• Demonstrated strong leadership skills and dependability.
  
• Effectively communicate and demonstrate strong time management skills as required.
  
• Able to work well under pressure and be able to meet deadlines
  
• Minimum three years solid management experience in a retail environment is required, including managing a staff, coaching, and meeting goals. Banking environment desirable.
  
• Excellent demonstrable time management, communication and motivational skills are necessary.
  
• Bachelor’s degree required or commensurate experience.
  
• Must be willing to work a flexible schedule, including some evenings and Saturdays.
  
• A valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle is required.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Consistently provide quality service as outlined in the Bank’s Quality Service Statement.
  
• Directly impact the growth and retention of customers through proactive efforts.  This can be accomplished by managing Online RB, ensuring their team is offering customers additional products and services, and holding regular monthly call nights to follow-up on any lists created by the Marketing Department, as well as, other sources of referrals from inside the branch.
  
• Focus on building a customer service driven team where everyone contributes to the success of the Relationship Building and Operational efforts.
  
• Develop and motivate the team members of their Office by offering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement. This can be accomplished at regular team meetings and through individual documented coaching sessions. Continue the development of the Operation and Relationship Manager’s leadership skills by offering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement through individual documented coaching sessions.
  
• Represent Dollar Bank in the community in a professional and competent manner at all times. Is expected to source business deposit and loan relationships within the surrounding communities through active participation in various organizations and charitable functions.
  
• Meet the established Group Banking Onsite Visit and Checking Accounts Opened goals each month. This will be accomplished by being proactive in outside calling efforts and by taking advantage all Group Banking opportunities within his market.
  
• Exhibit operational knowledge while upholding the operational integrity of the office by assisting the team in all areas of branch operations including Compliance.
  
• Achieve all Relationship Building, Operational Integrity, and Customer Service goals.
  
• Exercise sound decision-making skills as it relates to balancing risk, profitability, and customer service with every decision.
  
• Consistently lead by example, maintain professionalism and a positive attitude at all times and exercise superior leadership skills.

Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). We are seeking a Customer Service Specialist to support our Eastern Cuyahoga and Lake County branches.  As a Customer Service Specialist, you will be responsible for identifying our customers’ financial needs by providing a thorough analysis and recommending the most appropriate Dollar Bank products and services to fulfill those needs. You will use your customer service experience, product knowledge and positive demeanor to initiate, expand and retain customer relationships through customer conversations and outbound calling. We are looking for flexible, enthusiastic, hardworking individuals with a sincere appreciation for people and an empathetic communication style to proactively contribute to the branch sales and service goals. Candidate will support multiple branch locations in a specified region.

• Providing quality customer service in a positive, courteous and enthusiastic manner to all internal and external customers
  
• Contributing to the growth and retention of deposit and loan customers. Demonstrating a proactive sales approach to building customer relationships, effectively utilizing the customer conversations to promote Dollar Bank products and services and meeting the established Relationship Building goals set by your management team.
  
• Performing teller functions based upon the needs of the branch. Maintaining an acceptable balancing record while processing transactions in an accurate and efficient manner.
  
• Adhering to all established branch operational processes and procedures.

The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:
  

  
• High school diploma/GED required.
  
• College degree required, or a minimum of 1 year demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service in financial services or retail industry is required.
  
• Must have excellent written and verbal communication skills to include professional grammar and demeanor.

description:
The Senior Commercial Real Estate Underwriter will be primarily responsible for analyzing and preparing credit proposals for new and existing commercial real estate relationships. The job function will also include the monitoring of Borrower’s financial performance to assist in the risk rating process. In addition, the Senior Commercial Real Estate Underwriter will assist in the preparation of monthly reports, perform ongoing portfolio analysis and complete other duties as assigned.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
•  Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or related field, will consider commensurate experience.
  
•  Minimum 2 years work experience in analysis/underwriting of commercial loans.
  
•  Excellent oral and written communication skills in addition to strong analytical, problem solving and organizational skills.
  
•  Ability to work on multiple projects simultaneously, independently and achieve required objectives with limited supervision.
  
•  Ability to work within a team environment, interacting with peers and management within the bank, as well as, with customers and outside support (appraisers, attorneys, accountants, etc.).
  
•  Experience with real estate software a plus.
  
•  Experience in an appraisal related field a plus.
  
•  PA Real Estate License a plus.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
•  Perform underwriting of new and existing commercial real estate loans to assess the financial condition, repayment capacity and risks associated with the transaction. To include analysis of real estate cash flow, global cash flows, personal cash flow and personal financial statements.
  
•  Review and analyze loan documents, leases, sales agreements, appraisals and other related materials. Effectively communicate results of the underwriting in a written loan presentation for review by lenders and senior management.
  
•  May participate in on-site client meetings.
  
•  Assure all analysis and underwriting conforms to credit policy, banking regulations and commercial real estate underwriting policies.
  
•  Research data to obtain information regarding current and projected status of certain industries, borrowers and market trends to assist in determining its impact on both the real estate and banking industry.
  
•  Prepare monthly credit and portfolio loan reports.
  
•  Mentor and assist in training of less experienced commercial real estate underwriters.
  
•  Perform additional assignments as requested.

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
The VP, Real Estate Lending and Services is responsible for generating, underwriting and managing a medium size portfolio of commercial real estate loans. This individual will provide quality customer service and satisfaction while at the same time meeting a high level of credit quality consistent with the objectives of the Bank. This will be reflected in the accuracy, reliability, creativity, and consistency shown in analyzing, servicing and managing portfolios while effectively providing structural alternatives to customer loan requests.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• A Bachelor’s Degree in Business or a related field is required. Will consider commensurate experience. MBA preferred.
  
• Must have at least 5 years of experience in Commercial Real Estate Lending including negotiating loans, analyzing data, and providing exceptional customer service.
  
• Must have excellent math and analytical skills.
  
• Ability to make independent and sound decisions.
  
• Ability to work with and provide leadership to department employees.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Solicit and negotiate loan applications for commercial mortgage loans through owners and developers of commercial real estate and residential development.
  
• Obtain and analyze pertinent financial, credit and market data to determine the borrowers/guarantors credit worthiness and recommend terms and conditions of loan structure for borrower.
  
• Perform site inspections of perspective property and market area to ensure stability and integrity of the property.
  
• Prepare loan presentations for all appropriate committee approvals, which includes working with loan analysts and underwriting.
  
• Ensure that appraisal, flood certifications and other required documents are ordered prior to funding.
  
• Work with outside legal counsel to complete the real estate closing process by ensuring the proper preparation of required legal documents. Participate in closings of loans to ensure bank’s approval is documented to the agreed upon structure of the loan.
  
• Manage, daily, all customer relationships assigned by Bank. Includes monitoring other Bank related services within these relationships.
  
• Read trade publications, business newspapers, and economic forecasts and participate in appropriate trade organizations in order to develop an awareness of economic activity, current events and local ongoing activities in the real estate industry. Evaluate this market information as to its impact on real estate and banking industry.
  
• Perform additional assignments as requested.

Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). See, hear, talk and perform tasks requiring manual dexterity and visual acuity; sit, stand, walk, crouch,  reach, pull, push and other similar, repetitive tasks requiring physical activity. Able to operate standard office/computer equipment such as photocopiers, fax machines, computers, iPads, scanners, calculators, etc.

title: Senior Customer Service Specialist, Eastlake

description:
JOB FUNCTION/PURPOSE:
  

  
The Loan Administrator’s job is to ensure all real estate secured loans have the escrow lines accurately set up for tax, hazard/flood insurance, and PMI insurance. This includes obtaining the tax bills from the tax collector for payment, and the certification of payment on non-escrowed loans. This position is also responsible for ensuring all loans have sufficient hazard insurance to protect the collateral in the event of a loss. This includes payment of premiums on escrowed loans and confirmation of renewal coverage on non-escrowed loans.
  

  
QUALIFICATIONS:
  

  
*High School diploma or GED required
  
*Knowledge of loan documents preferred
  
*Knowledge of RESPA and CFPB regulations preferred
  
*1 year previous clerical type office experience  preferred
  
*Must be able to manage time efficiently, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines
  
*Must have strong propensity for detail, accuracy, and work independently with minimal supervision in a team setting is required
  
*Must have excellent mathematical and analytical skills
  
*Must have excellent telephone, written, and verbal communication skills
  
*Must be professional and courteous with internal and external customers
  
*Working knowledge of Windows and Microsoft Office applications
  
*Must be able to type accurately 25 words per minute (will be tested)
  

  
PRINCIPAL ACTIVITIES/OBJECTIVES:
  

  
*Maintain compliance with all federal, state agencies, and internal policies/procedures
  
*Review tax/insurance reports identifying items that need paid/updated and generate those disbursements in a timely manner
  
*Use websites or make/receive calls from tax authorities, insurance agents/companies, or customers to obtain tax/insurance premium amounts or certify proof of payment
  
*Process EDI hazard billings, insurance changes, and hazard cancellations/reinstatements
  
*Set up tax, insurance, and pmi lines on new loans
  
*Research questions/problems as requested from other departments
  
*Match the checks to the vouchers on tax/hazard disbursements
  
*Cover and operate switchboard for incoming calls and transfer them to the appropriate person
  
*Open, identify, process daily tax/insurance mail, faxes, and e-mails
  
*Send letters/mortgagee clause  to tax authorities/insurance companies
  
*Forward assessment notices from the taxing authority to customers
  
*File tax receipts/insurance information
  
*Participate in and supply information requested for various audits
  
*Assist in special projects
  

  
Note:
  

  
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

title: Senior Customer Service Specialist

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
Primarily responsible for managing, mentoring and training the team of the corporate underwriting staff and preparing credit proposals for new and existing corporate credit relationships.  This individual will collaborate with the Corporate Lending Officers on due diligence of credit requests, specifically for middle market clients.  In addition, the Manager will ensure the accuracy of management reports and compliance with regards to department and regulatory policies and practices.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Bachelor’s degree in Business, preferably Accounting or Finance required. Will consider commensurate experience.
  
• Minimum of 10-years’ experience within a financial institution, performing credit risk analysis and corporate C & I underwriting including minimum 2 years of supervisory experience.
  
• Strong analytical and underwriting skills.
  
• Excellent oral and written communication skills.
  
• Strong organizational skills.
  
• Ability to self-start and work independently.
  
• Possess strong judgment and decision-making skills.
  
• Ability to work and manage within a team environment, interacting with reports, peers and senior management within the Bank as well as customers and outside third-party professionals.
  
• Knowledge of MS Suite of Products (Word, Excel, and Outlook) as well as minimum 2 years’ experience utilizing Moody’s Financial Analyst/Risk Analyst or similar tools.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Review and evaluate all loan presentations prepared by the team of corporate underwriters.
  
• Assist and provide back-up support to the SVP Credit.
  
• Responsible for the preparation of quality, detailed financial analysis including cash flow models and collateral evaluations in order to identify potential credit risks.
  
• Capable of evaluating complex financial statements and analyze in order to prepare a credit review.
  
• Make recommendations in accordance with sound banking practices in order to minimize risk exposure.
  
• Ensure commercial loan requests adhere to bank policies and procedures.
  
• Effectively communicate and partner with the Corporate Lenders to assist with monitoring of the loan portfolio.
  
• May participate in off-site and on-site client meetings as required.
  
• Serve as a resource for credit questions from Corporate Lenders on new and existing commercial loan requests.
  
• Completion of special projects as required by senior management and other additional responsibilities as requested.
  
• Prepare loan presentations accurately and in a timely manner.
  
• Some contact with customers, conducting relationships in a professional manner that will enhance the overall marketing effort of the bank.
  

  
Supervisory Responsibilities:
  

  
• Supervise, provide support and training as well as prioritize and schedule work assignments for Corporate Underwriters.
  
• Prepares Corporate Underwriters’ annual reviews and recommends salary increases.

description:
Dollar Bank is currently seeking a Branch Manager for its Maple Heights branch. The Branch Manager is responsible for the overall production of the branch, team development, and efficient daily operation of a full service office.
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
• Demonstrated ability to deliver outstanding customer service.
  
• Proficient computer skills, math aptitude and attention to detail is a must.
  
• Demonstrated strong leadership skills and dependability.
  
• Effectively communicate and demonstrate strong time management skills as required.
  
• Able to work well under pressure and be able to meet deadlines
  
• Minimum three years solid management experience in a retail environment is required, including managing a staff, coaching, and meeting goals. Banking environment desirable.
  
• Excellent demonstrable time management, communication and motivational skills are necessary.
  
• Bachelor’s degree required or commensurate experience.
  
• Must be willing to work a flexible schedule, including some evenings and Saturdays.
  
• A valid driver’s license and access to a reliable vehicle is required.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
• Consistently provide quality service as outlined in the Bank’s Quality Service Statement.
  
• Directly impact the growth and retention of customers through proactive efforts.  This can be accomplished by managing Online RB, ensuring their team is offering customers additional products and services, and holding regular monthly call nights to follow-up on any lists created by the Marketing Department, as well as, other sources of referrals from inside the branch.
  
• Focus on building a customer service driven team where everyone contributes to the success of the Relationship Building and Operational efforts.
  
• Develop and motivate the team members of their Office by offering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement. This can be accomplished at regular team meetings and through individual documented coaching sessions. Continue the development of the Operation and Relationship Manager’s leadership skills by offering constructive feedback and positive reinforcement through individual documented coaching sessions.
  
• Represent Dollar Bank in the community in a professional and competent manner at all times. Is expected to source business deposit and loan relationships within the surrounding communities through active participation in various organizations and charitable functions.
  
• Meet the established Group Banking Onsite Visit and Checking Accounts Opened goals each month. This will be accomplished by being proactive in outside calling efforts and by taking advantage all Group Banking opportunities within his market.
  
• Exhibit operational knowledge while upholding the operational integrity of the office by assisting the team in all areas of branch operations including Compliance.
  
• Achieve all Relationship Building, Operational Integrity, and Customer Service goals.
  
• Exercise sound decision-making skills as it relates to balancing risk, profitability, and customer service with every decision.
  
• Consistently lead by example, maintain professionalism and a positive attitude at all times and exercise superior leadership skills.
  

  
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
  
Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). title: Customer Service Specialist

description:
Job Overview:
  

  
The Vice President of Lending establishes and manages a portfolio of high net worth clients to include various types of loans and deposits. The individual will develop and manage all aspects of the relationship. The individual will also coordinate and assess financial scenarios and act as a referral source to other asset areas of Dollar Bank. The Vice President will work with Financial Planners, Brokers, CPA’s, and Attorneys, with the objective of providing optimal solutions for the client. The individual also properly collects information and monitors credit of the client. The Private Banking Department offers its high net worth customers a broad array of services, each tailored to an individual client’s needs. These services include, but are not limited to, a variety of credit products such as commercial loans, mortgage loans and home equity loans as well as selection of deposit products such as Checking and Savings accounts, CDs, IRA as well as Money Market Accounts
  

  
Qualifications:
  

  
•Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or related field required. Will consider commensurate experience. MBA preferred.
  
•Minimum of 5 years of lending experience in Private Banking or commercial lending experience required.
  
•Previous supervisory experience.
  
•Solid credit/ underwriting skills required.
  
•Solid understanding of legal and regulatory issues associated with the lending function, as well as documentation requirements is also needed.
  
•Must possess strong analytical, organizational, and customer service skills.
  
•Exceptional oral and written communication skills required.
  
•Proficiency in computer skills including Microsoft Work & Excel required.
  
•Solid understanding of collateral, valuation, perfections and liquidation is preferred.
  
•Must have excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to be a team leader as well as a team player in a professional team setting.
  

  
Principle Activities and Duties:
  

  
•Source and develop new client relationships to include loans and deposits.
  
•Gather financial information and underwrite loan reports.
  
•Put in proposal format and present to Division Head and Credit Committees for approval.
  
•Administer and maintain loan portfolio.
  
•Meet a minimum of $10 million annual loan production plus associated deposit accounts to develop solid and consistent relationships with the clients.
  
•Maintain high credit standards to ensure that the highest levels of the portfolio quality are achieved.
  
•Ensure that proper and complete loan documentation is prepared and executed, and that security conformity with loan covenants, collateral advance ratios and other conditions.
  
•As necessary, manage workouts, ensuring maximum preservation of principal for the Bank.
  
•Further develop and refer business to other asset areas of Dollar Bank to include, but not limit to: Corporate Banking, Treasury Management, Business Banking and Commercial Real Estate.
  
•Participate in professional associations and community activities to increase Dollar Bank’s visibility and enhance new business opportunities.
  

  
Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:
  
Perform sedentary to light work (able to lift up to 20 pounds from floor to waist, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to lift, carry, push, pull, grasp, or otherwise move objects). See, hear, talk and perform tasks requiring manual dexterity and visual acuity; sit, stand, walk, crouch, reach, pull, push and other similar, repetitive tasks requiring physical activity. Able to operate standard office/computer equipment such as photocopiers, fax machines, computers, iPads, scanners, calculators, etc.
  

  
Note:
  
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.

**FLSA:**  Exempt
